Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Cyclophile
Reviews.Content: I bought this with a little trepidation but It works great. I am a Mac person and unfortunately, you do need to downgrade to a pc in order to do some of the configuration (using the ip assign tool, setting up the motion detection).. but since I am bi-OSulal, I have a netbook that did the trick.  (there are bits that require activeX.. which means ie only! Grrr...)Setting up the wireless was a little tricky. Know your router! My current router (from ATT) is a bit kludgy but I got it working fine on the network.But once you have your network figured out, its a snap...My only complaint is the field of view. Its field of view is a little narrow and I'm only able to get a portion of my target room into view (using it to watch the dogs when they're confined in a particular room).Also.. 'specially for mac users.. there's a better app for the recording, etc.. than the one its boxed with.. google is your friend..There's also a nifty app in the app store for Android that'll let you watch the camera on your android phone (assuming you have the cam configured to view outside your network)

Reviews.Title: IP110
Reviews.Author: Harriram Oumadath
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my first venture into IP Security. I must admit, that at this price, it's a steal of a deal. Of course, low light visibility is no good as it is not a day/night. For home users, I would recommend the Trendnet line anytime. Excellent product for my needs. Next stop, Day/Night PTZ for outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Great, If you can get it to work.
Reviews.Author: S. Haywood
Reviews.Content: This operates great, if you can get it to work.  I went through 3 of them before I was able to find one that worked - Even did an RMA on one.  Finally, got one that worked - and still works.  Each time I got a new one, I followed the setup instructions, whiched worked fine.  After a short time the camera would lock-up and not respond. Tech support was great, but had the same problem.  Kept trying new units and finally got one to work.  This is a great bargin for the money - if it works.

Reviews.Title: Good Equip, but not easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Thomas W.
Reviews.Content: Although the equipment worked well, it was very difficult to set it up through the computer.. took the help of a computer "expert" to get it up and running..

Reviews.Title: Not secure: Beware.
Reviews.Author: Glenn Connery
Reviews.Content: "A few weeks ago, a blog called Console Cowboys exposed a security vulnerability in some models of Trendnet home security cameras..."[...]

Reviews.Title: Good for the price, just dont shake it
Reviews.Author: James A Kinter
Reviews.Content: This camera (I own 2) is OK quality for the price (<$75).One issue I have is that vibration seems to knock it out of focus, even with the focal ring around the lens taped down.So there must be something internal loose on both cams.One is mounted atop a tower in a wx-proof box to stream live video across the mesh network to the webserver:[...] .While the other is mounted to a portable cooler:  [...] @ 1:42 to 2:55 in the video.I had set the focus perfectly, but by the time we got the push-up pole extended up, the focus was off, and seems to get worse after the wind moves it around a little. Or on the cooler-cam, it would go out just walking around with it.I guess if you set it on a desk and dont touch it or have the washing machine across the house vibrate your desk it would stay perfectly focused.Ill probably go Foscam next time.I have used those at a buddy's, and they are rock solid and great video, and under $100

Reviews.Title: Lots of interference.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Wilcock
Reviews.Content: This camera is ok. I used to to monitor a printing station at my job about 30' away through a wall.  You should know that it's susceptible to interference. Even someone just walking across the room will cause interference.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera.... but you must know how to modify your router's setting
Reviews.Author: seanece
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great little camera. The picture is very good for what I am using it for (viewing inside home).I see a lot of reviews for this product complaining about the Wireless Function. Please follow the directions and CD provided. Also, you will need a moderate amount of EXPERIENCE modifying your router to ensure the Static or Dynamic settings are correct as well as your IP range.Please, PLEASE read up on basic internet setup for your house before buying this product.Again, my camera is flawless and I highly suggest the camera, but some settings you may need to know how to modify yourself. Please do not blame the camera or manufacturer.P.S. Also, update the firmware to ensure OPEN-SHARED capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Afobos
Reviews.Content: I've got three of this cameras monitoring my house and they work great come rain or shine.  Sometimes they'll freez up and I have to unplug them and plug them back in but it doesn't happen that often.  If I had them wired in it wouldn't happen at all so it's probably due to signal strength.

Reviews.Title: Working good for the price
Reviews.Author: Marian Boricean "Born in 1977 passioned of te...
Reviews.Content: I have bought this camera to use it with Zoneminder in linux. I don't have a Windows computer in the network where this camera is installed, therefore, I could not fully test it in the browser (Requires IE and activeX plugin installed).It's not a bad camera (I am still struggling to get the wireless working) for the price, but next time I will buy an Axis.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the Price but Not for Novice Users
Reviews.Author: CrazyRussian
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have set it up so that it drops images to my FTP every few seconds. There are apps available for both Android and iOS devices so that you can view the camera remotely.You need light to get a good quality image. In hindsight I should have bought a camera with night vision but it's a minor gripe since those cost a lot more.Another con with this camera is that you have to be more or less computer savvy. What this means is that you need to be able to log in to your router control panel and set up port forwarding if you want to monitor your camera remotely (outside of your house). If you want to record images, you need to have access to an FTP server.Otherwise, this is an excellent buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Charles Gallagher "Lessards Gutters"
Reviews.Content: I got this for a gift form my brother.  The camera was a little difficult getting it all set up and I am a computer nerd.  I would give this 5 stars if it came with a better how to setup video/diagram.  I would recommend this to anyone who is needing a cheap camera and has some computer/networking skills.  Its wireless range is pretty good, atleast for my router.  I have it mounted on my back porch to keep an eye on my dog.  ITs atleast 100 ft from router and there are many walls inbetween router and camera.

Reviews.Title: Bad product, better options available.
Reviews.Author: Dan "Dan"
Reviews.Content: The good:The spces are nice, and the box it comes in is green, and green is a nice color. With a wired connection it works well from my testing.The bad:The WiFi range is terrible. Spotty connection from 30 feet away through 1 wall with a high power router. From the same spot my iPhone has full bars for my network. The web user interface cashes over WiFi if any packets are lost. Once the web interface cashes it does not recover until you unplug and re-plug. I updated to the latest firmware (V1.1.0.104 - 3/2011) to no avail. Sent it back as defective by design.Bottom line:Do not get this product! I went with the Foscam FI8909W-NA. It's infinitely more stable and reliable with much better range on the WiFi and a wider angle lens. Only down side is that I'm only getting 2 fps, which I can live with because it doesn't crash incessantly like this TRENDnet TV-110W did.

Reviews.Title: Would have been happy if they'd just sent me one working unit...
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: First off, I work for a network consulting firm and even I was banging my head against the wall with this thing.You don't need the software to install, just type the IP of the camera into the address bar and you can access the web interface.  You can use the IP finder tool off the CD; the other software is useless.The only design flaw from a software/UI perspective is the email notification server.  Anyone who has an actual working unit, use gmail-smtp-in.l as your email server and have two gmail accounts, one to send and one to receive.  Don't use authentication or it won't work.  Credit for the tip goes to a guy in one of the other camera forums badmouthing this one, heh.  As far as the sensitivity issue, you're on your own....Hardware is a different story.  The issue I had with both cameras sent to me was that they wouldn't hold a configuration.  I'd set it up, two seconds later it went back to defaults.  Firmware updates didn't resolve the issue and probably exacerbated it because it got even buggier.TrendNet support sent their two replies and then stopped responding, so defective units must be the norm for them.  Too bad, good price and most of the features I wanted; just send me a working product next time and I won't have to return them - twice....

Reviews.Title: FTP and image clarity
Reviews.Author: John J. Wallace "JJWallace"
Reviews.Content: I've been running this camera for several months and have four negatives: 1) The filenames on ftp images are unique, which means you can't ftp an image to a web site without some active scripting to present the "latest" image.  Tech support said that's the way it is and no hope for future upgrades. 2) The live streaming website really hangs a lot.  I've given up trying to find out why and have a utility power timer set to power off for four different one minute periods through the day - this has dramatically improved my camera's net availability.  3) In order to support live streaming the compression is so high the images is highly pixellated.  I'd be happy with a once a second update or slower if I could get a sharp image, but no such option.  4) The live streaming image requires Java (vs. Flash) which is useless for viewing on my Android phone, coupled with my first comment means I have no means to view my camera from my phone.One other nit is that the mounting threads are so close to the antenna that I had to purchase an extender just to mount the camera on a stand I have for the camera.  I think this camera has value if you just want a remote view on the world but these issues keep it from getting a five star review from me.

Reviews.Title: SW Install Failed - Consistently
Reviews.Author: William Evins
Reviews.Content: Installing the software failed with an infinite loop. Resulting in the camera not being functional. I have many years in computer network support and this was an easy fail.

Reviews.Title: Good product easy to use, nice app for droid
Reviews.Author: Patrick Murphy
Reviews.Content: Pretty easy to setup, you just need to forward a port on your wireless router.  Once you get that, the rest is easy.  All items that connect to your wireless router get assigned an IP in sequence, xxx.xxx.x.101, xxx.xxx.x.102 one of these will be the camera.  You forward a port say 800 on the IP address assigned to the camera.  Keep in mind, if you restart the wireless router, the camera may get reassinged and you will need to forward the port on the new IP it gets assigned.It works great so far.  Had it for about 4 months.  I can check in on the house over the internet on my droid and take snap shots.  I haven't tried the motion detection and automatic notification.  Thinking of buying another camera, maybe the one with two way sound next.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: B. Benito "brian"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to install in my living room to watch my newborn twins from work.  Installation took a little over an hour because I refused to install it by using and following the directions that came with the packaging.After I gave up trying to instal via my own intuition, the camera was up and running in 10 mins.  I bought two cameras in the original purchase and am considering with buying 2 more to install facing the front door to keep an eye on the hooligans in my neighborhood.Thumbs up with this camera and I am looking to buy a outdoor housing as well.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Adam Caron
Reviews.Content: I have two of these in my house and two at work.Pros:* Quality: Decent quality picture considering the size and cost, provided there is a reasonable amount of light. A darkened room with light from 1 window will be fairly low quality. A darkened room with no light inside will be unusable. If you are expecting HD cinematic quality from a double digit priced camera, you are probably going to be disappointed.* Setup: very easy to use and setup. If you don't have basic knowledge of networks and opening ports and such you will probably have issues, but I doubt that is different than any other camera. With basic router knowledge you should have no problems setting it up. Also had no problems getting it to save snapshots via FTP, everything is pretty self-explanatory.Cons:* Low light: Not really bad considering the size of it and the fact that it is not billed as a low-light camera, but keep in mind that it needs normal-indoor lighting for a good picture.* Setup: only complaint I have is getting it to use an NTP server to set the time. For some reason so matter what I do it never seems to set the time automatically, so whenever the power is pulled I need to manually reset the time and date.* Mobile connection: The cameras require Java or Active-X applets that most mobile browsers don't seem to like. There are work-arounds available through undocumented functions but it would be nice if they were more directly supported.* Reliability: occasionally stops responding randomly for no reason and needs to be unplugged and plugged back in to reset. Only happens once every few months, but something to keep in mind if its placed somewhere inconvenient.Overall, even knowing the limitations and quirks, I continue to buy them and it was my first recommendation when we needed 2 cameras for work.

Reviews.Title: reasonable picture
Reviews.Author: alchemyiam
Reviews.Content: I found the setup reasonably straightforward using both the advice on Newegg and Amazon (and accomplished using the Trendnet IPSETUP software).The Trendnet Secureview software was not so impressive. I moved to another package (vitamin d) and found motion detection, film clip storage etc. a breeze after that.System runs well on Google chrome and picture good if care taken to setup focus and other camera parameters.Update 12/31/12Eventually gave up using this device. Trying to keep the software running, PC setup, IP address up-to-date etc. etc. was too time consuming. Eventually went with the DROPCAM webcams - software is a breeze to setup, good quality image, good night vision etc.

Reviews.Title: Decent quality camera, average software
Reviews.Author: LeFrog
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these cameras during lightning deals. Around $50 this camera is a good deal.Here are main points.Pros:- easy to setup- no subscription or fees to view cameras from the Internet- user account (for just viewing) + admin account (to setup)- decent quality picture- automatic emails on motion detectionCons:- setup only works with Internet Explorer (activeX plugin)- very poor motion detection- recording software does not support large disks- no night vision, very low quality in low light environments

Reviews.Title: Hardware ok - software awful - support a joke
Reviews.Author: Ronald Albury
Reviews.Content: The hardware works fine ... it does everything it is supposed to do (although not as sharply or clearly as I would have liked).  However, the software they supply to interact with the camera is awful.Much of the software set-up was counter-intuitive, and the documentation they provide is nearly useless.  When I ran into some problems (after I had owned for about 8 months) I downloaded and installed the software update.  However, the install program for the new version didn't properly deal with the previous version's DLL's and after installing the new version the application refused to run at all.  I contacted their support group and their only suggestion was that I find a backup of my system from prior to installing their software and restore my system.Conclusion:  If you buy this camera plan on either spending lots of time screwing with the software, or else buy a different software package (there are several out there that work with TrendNet cameras).

Reviews.Title: Hardware good - software awful - support a joke
Reviews.Author: Ronald Albury
Reviews.Content: The hardware works fine ... it does everything it is supposed to do.  However, the software they supply to interact with the camera is awful.Much of the software set-up was counter-intuitive, and the documentation they provide is nearly useless. Reviews.Title: Difficult Install - Great once it is setup.
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: I read most or all recent reviews before purchasing this product so I was well aware of the difficulty in the installation. It was, but with help from tech support cameras are fine now.  I purchased 2 of these here at Amazon for $65ea and installed one in back and other in front of my home.Pros. Watch from anywhere you have internet access.  Reasonably good picture.  Blinking LED in front of camera can be on or off.  Motion detection/eMail notification.  Great techinical support.  PEACE OF MIND - Knowing I can call my local Police at a moments notice.Cons. Difficult to install and setup.  Not for outdoor/night time use unless brightly lit.Overall, I am very satisfied.*******************************UPDATE***********************************************April 28,2011: both cameras have been up and running since October last year. Have had no problems. I purchased an EVO 4G cell and found two free android apps to monitor my cams. Both apps were done by Trendnet...Secure View Mobile and TrendyCam.now I can monitor my cams on my cell by touching one Icon.SWEET! Going to Europe soon, so I will update if this works overseas on the EVO...************************************************************************************

Reviews.Title: Love the quality. Wish it had Mac Software.
Reviews.Author: jimmy
Reviews.Content: Quality is great for the price. It takes a little extra know how to setup with OS X since it doesn't have a quick installer. I'm going to purchase a few more. Cam Viewer works great with iPhone 4.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "techie"
Reviews.Content: This works well for local and remote monitoring. The included instructions make local setup simple, but for remote setup you should watch the video from TrendNet on Amazon and Youtube. The shows you how to set up the camera and a router with a free DNS service, which adapts to a changing IP address from your service provider. I have seen the camera freeze occasionally, but a reset from the web browser will start it up again. The date and time will have to be set, too.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera when it doesn't lock-up
Reviews.Author: Researched buy in SF Bay area
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 6 months.  It took me three or four hours before getting it reasonably well setup, with ftp picture captures, etc.  Never did get the email alerts to work.  Works well with iPhone's iCam app, and the app's motion detection seems to capture things that make sense for a motion capture than I could get with the Trendnet software.  My problem has been wired or wireless the camera locks up and apparently loses its connection to my network.  Maybe this is a problem with my network but not sure.  Anyway, I was getting only ~1 hr between lock ups, so sent a ticket to Trendnet.  After a few emails back and forth over a few days, I was issued an RMA.  Sent the camera back and got a replacement about a week later.  I hooked it up same as the previous one, and 23 minutes later it froze (green light stopped blinking).  I will retry a few times and see if things are consistent, and possibly try on a few different connections I have.  If the same thing happens I may try a different brand to see I get the same behavior as it is too late to return this one...

Reviews.Title: Flaky product, horrible instructions
Reviews.Author: Ian T. Bui
Reviews.Content: Couldn't configure the camera at first. Nothing showed up in the Config GUI. Contacted Trendnet support, and after a few email exchanges I was told to send unit back. Got a new one, which came up right away. Apparently the one I had was defective somehow.Everything went fairly smooth after that. But there's no instructions on how to configure the camera for remote monitoring, which is what we bought it for. Perhaps I'm missing something in the User's Guide, but I still can't find that info. Any help would be much appreciated. What I want to do is be able to monitor the house from our iPhones.The camera itself is not bad. Picture quality is reasonable. The power cord (black!) is too short though, so hanging camera from ceiling can be aesthetically unpleasing.Update: After logging out of the webcam, when I logged back in I could no longer see the Live View. Tried rebooting the camera from the GUI, tried unplugging power. Nothing has worked so far. Not sure what the problem is. What a frustrating purchase...

Reviews.Title: Keep looking
Reviews.Author: Frank Dwyer "Enjoy Life"
Reviews.Content: I do not have a great deal of experience with video cameras. I have 10+ years experience in computer networking. I can tell you that this product produces decent quality video but the recording is just about worthless. Motion recordings do not work while contant recording takes up enormous amounts of storage leaving the product useless for my application I purchased it for. The wireless signal needs to be excellent for the device to work properly. If you havent already be prepared to relocate your access point for optimal coverage of your property, deal with constant connection issues or be faced with approx 15 ft wireless range. In the end I wish I never purchased the product. Dont be fooled into thinking your getting a great deal here. Not being bitter I am thinking I need to spend a bit more money to get the product I need. I will end up using this product for my website streaming live footage of my aquarium. I havent done that yet so cross your fingers.

Reviews.Title: For very basic needs only.
Reviews.Author: Senior Frog "Hungry Man"
Reviews.Content: I replaced an existing camera that stopped working with this TrendNet model.The software is much harder to setup. The camera required "Reboot" everyday to stream video. Fortunately this can be done remotely. The email alert, motion sensor and upload of frames to email doesn't work. Lighting conditions have to be perfect to get a decent video.If this is your first Internet Camera, you may like it simply because it's cool to be able to see what's going on in your house while your gone. But if your used to the features found on something like the Panasonic BL-C111A Network Camera. You will not like this camera.I've come to depend on the ability to pan, tilt and email upload of camera frames when motion is detected. With the TrendNet, if your not watching when it happens, you won't see it. That's a big flaw!My previous camera (a panasonic) wasn't perfect. But it did last 2.5 years, required very few resets and up until it died, I would have recommended the panasonic.The Trendnet is barely better than a toy.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Mostafa Sobh
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good for the price and easy to install. Just follow the instruction provided then configure your router for port forwarding. If you don't have a static IP address then just use a no-ip service. I was able to access the camera remotely after the configuration. The night version is very poor but if you have lights then it has a very clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: S. Russert
Reviews.Content: The image quality isn't great, but hey, it's 640 x 480.  I use it for a webcam view of the mountains, and wish I had a telephoto lens.  But, the install was easy, it actually has lots of configurability, and the wireless works great (probably 50-60 feet from my base station). For views of a room, or area of the house, the picture is good.  It can be configured for artificial light or daylight, and adapts well. I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: IP110W - Delighted with it
Reviews.Author: John Warner
Reviews.Content: I bought this on sale and I'm so happy with it I have ordered another off sale. Image quality is better than I would have expected at this price. To get better you'll have to spend much more. I don't give it 5 stars because of it low light quality. But this isn't sold as a night cam. I would also have liked access to a couple of extra settings on the network set up but the average user would not care about this so it isn't perfect but not far off. For simple casual use this is a great buy and an easy way to keep an eye on things around the house from work. I think someone else here has pointed out it has Linux at its heart which is nice. The UPnP ability is a nice feature in your home network. For the price I haven't seen a better camera.

Reviews.Title: okay IP cam
Reviews.Author: George Gorospe "GG"
Reviews.Content: the date and time even with the latest firmware the date is only up to 2008

Reviews.Title: Awesome Nanny Cam for the price
Reviews.Author: ZombieTalk "zombietalk"
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at the resolution of this camera. I have been using it as a nanny cam for about a month and it always works just as expected.I only have one small complaint. When the camera loses power, it forgets the date and the time. I still rate it a 5 cause the date/time on it are unimportant to me.

Reviews.Title: OK camera, somewhat lousy interface
Reviews.Author: ET
Reviews.Content: The image quality is pretty good - definitely no more resolution than panasonic but aggressive noise reduction, so it looks a lot cleaner, though I would argue it's too smeary. Live view is laggy. FTP allows a maximum of 2fps upload. Also, there is a 4mb chip inside, but whatever it's used for, it's not to buffer images. at ~30kb each 640x480 jpg, you better have 240kbps pipe to and from your ftp server if you don't want to drop frames. Unit and wall wart get quite warm, even with wireless disabled. No external on/off switch. Must use IE to configure the motion sensor (some have reported IE tabs in FF works, but it didn't for me). Mine didn't have WPA, only WEP. Tried a firmware update and the interface claimed the FW didn't match the unit (yes I double checked).I can't totally dog it, because it's half the price of the panasonics, and it does more or less work, though its a hassle to configure, but the panasonics are better cameras w/ a better interface. Barring an epiphany, these will be going back.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Jes1510
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a project without knowing for sure how it would perform.  The video is nice and smooth over a Wireless G connection and latency is less than a second.  Images are nice and crisp and look great for a cheaper camera.  The power supply is rated at 5vDC and 2.5A although I have not measured the power consumption.  Overall I'm really pleased with it.Setup was a breeze if you take the time to read the instructions.  Keep in mind I am definitely what would be called a technical guy but even I read the instructions.  Everything worked great the first time.If anyone cares, this camera does work out of the box with the latest release of Roborealm.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Eric M. Mieses
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is top notch. I would like this camera to work at night but is not designed for that. During day light is awesome. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Camara for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Pereira "magon"
Reviews.Content: I had a previous survillance wireless camera at home and now I ordered 2 more cameras. This amazing device has a really good quality on the image, has night vision,speaker/mic to listen the room where the camera is placed. Also, I can reach my cameras over the internet from any laptop or from any iPhone or Android.I definitely will recommend this camera for your home, small business, home/business

Reviews.Title: Great with ZoneMinder
Reviews.Author: Muddy "David VT"
Reviews.Content: This successfully replaced an old USB webcam and allowed me go green by turning off a PC that interfaced the old USB webcam.It took me a couple evenings to get the TRENDnet to work properly but it was a good challenge since the outcome is fantastic.I installed zoneminder on ubuntu 9.04 on VMWARE ESXi4 on a Quad Dell 520 Desktop Inspiron.  No suprises and the webcam works great!!!The ESXi4 install is being used to clean up my office of numerous power consuming computers.Buy the TRENDnet and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: Camera works well but...
Reviews.Author: Schnauzer
Reviews.Content: This is a good internet camera and works well when it is WITHIN a home network.  It is not easy to set up however.  I had to make several calls to TRENDNET tech support to get the camera working and it only works inside my network.  In other words, I cannot view the camera from outside my network.  It may be something in the router or the modem, but neither TRENDNET nor VERIZON could get it working when trying to access it from outside my home network.  That was the frustrating part.  Right now I am using it within my netowrk to keep an eye on my cats upstairs.

Reviews.Title: Tottaly will not work!!!
Reviews.Author: Randy M "rdm"
Reviews.Content: I've set up lots of internet cams. U just plug them in wired (at first), install software to detect it and set it up. But this Treadnet TV IP 110W? A huge no go! The cam was detected, but will not keep a stable wired IP. Online-offline. Back and forth. And totally unable to access this to change IP or view via their software. You know.. we shoud not have to F... mess with this stuff like this to get it to work. It should just do its thing. Period.This cam is going back asap. At least Amazon is paying for return ship. Will NEVER buy any trendnet items again... never ever never! Setup should always be a no brainer. This internet cam is a total waste of time.

Reviews.Title: Confusing setup
Reviews.Author: LookOutBelow
Reviews.Content: The instructions for this camera were  too ambiguous (flow/order of screen prompts incorrect, missing steps, vague, etc), and after spending 5 hours with this product, I decided it was no longer worth having.  Although the camera components  do seem like they are made well, I only will give this product 2 stars because consumer electronics should be easier to setup than this.  You need to have prior knowledge of IP addressing and network setup, and don't expect a well thought out install wizard to do it for you.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Stopped working after 2 hours... whenever I would go to the webpage it would just stop working.  I tried it wireless and wired.  Sending it back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Does Not Work In Sunlight
Reviews.Author: Reed White
Reviews.Content: I gave the TRENDnet TV-1P110W camera three stars because it works well in normal room lighting, but produces a [useless] white screen when pointed out the window at terrain lighted by sunlight.  In other words, this is not the camera you want for looking at your yard through a window.  In my experience, an Axis 207W works well for both inside and outside views, except that the Axis 207W seems to hang every week or so (requiring a power cycle reboot).Mac users should note that a Windows PC is required for setup.  Afterwards, a browser on a Mac seems to work for most functions.  (However I don't think the digital zoom works on a Mac.)This camera has a handy FTP feature, which enables the user to send a series of .jpg files to a host computer.  The feature works, but I could not find a way to simply send a file on interval or event with the SAME filename every time.  This is what you need if your application is to update a photo on a website every time there is movement or on an interval of, say, 30 seconds.I have some computer savvy, yet I find setting up a new webcam to be frustrating at times.  Anyone who is computer-phobic should definitely expect to invest time and frustration in setting up any unfamiliar network webcam -- but the result will hopefully justify the effort!

Reviews.Title: Bad Compatability.  Bad Manual.  Does work, sort of.
Reviews.Author: SH
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for someone.  The day after Christmas, the price is almost half what I paid a few weeks ago.This camera has mediocre image quality and works terribly in dim situations.After fighting it for hours, I discovered it has no ability to use DNS names.  Only IP addresses can be used.  So if you want to set it up to synch with a time server, you have to use the IP of the time server.  Once I got past that, I discovered there is no abillty included to log into an email smtp server securely.  So it won't work with hotmail, gmail, or maybe your own ISP.  This may require leaving a computer running to send email or log the images.The manual is horrible with bad English and simply no explanation whatsoever of the menus and features.  There was a printed multi-lingual quick setup manual and a semi-useless PDF manual on the CD.The included cord on the A/C adapter is way too short.  It's also black while the camera is white/silver.  That may seem like a small factor.  But considering it comes with a fairly nice, heavy mount for the wall, the cord is too short to get power to it.  Then there's this black a/c adapter dangling in the middle of the wall with an extension cord.Motion detection has two regions that can be set, which is handy.  We've found it works inconsistently.  For example, in about a 5-10 second period, it sent about 30 emailed imaged even though it was set to send 1 email every 3 seconds.  This may again be due to the bad manual and lack of explanation of how any of it works.I'd have felt better if I got it for the 60 bucks it's on sale for now instead of the over one hundred I paid.  For 60, it's an ok deal, even with the problems.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Mark Lee Welton
Reviews.Content: This product was very easy to install.  Not being an IT person this product scared me, but it was very easy to install and use for basic security use.  I am purchasing three more of these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Small camera
Reviews.Author: J. S. Butler
Reviews.Content: This camera is a nice compact one. It is average quality but it is easy to set up and works good.

Reviews.Title: Better When It Cost Less
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This product was much better yesterday (4-14-09) when the price on Amazon.Com was $67.96 (guess they figure we all have big tax refund coming).  Price jump of $40.00?  If you want it, buy it from TigerDirect.Com or CompUSA.Com where the price doesn't go up 40% overnight!

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Papa Carlo
Reviews.Content: If you want from time to time to look at your place through the monitor the camera will do the job.  Kind of as the image quality is very so so.But if you want to rely on this as the security camera look somewhere else.I installed it over my porch. The camera worked fine. I set it up to send motion activated images to my ftp server.The first thing I noticed that even though there is a lot of light the quality of the images is such that you will not be able to recognize the face even if the person is looking straight at the camera.But that is of no importance as in a week the camera stopped connecting to the computer. Sometimes it still sends some images to the ftp server when it is pleased but I do not see it from the computer anymore.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: G. Brendel "GABE"
Reviews.Content: I have 2 Wireless cameras, they work perfect, in (my particular case) I have to many problems to make it work remotely,because my router ,great factory soport , I can see the cameras with my IPHONE, IN CASE YOU CAN'T MAKE IT WORK DON'T GUIVE UP, JUST CALL SOMEBODY ELSE . IF YOU ARE INTERESTING TO GET A 24 HR CAMERA THIS IS THE WRONG ON, YOU NEED TO BUY THE DAY AND NIGHT.THE PICTURE I HAVE IN MY iPHONE IS PERFECT BUT STILL YOU WILL HAVE A 5 SECONDS DELAY UNFORTUNATELY IS NOT A 100% REAL TIME, BUT IN MY COMPUTER IT IS A 100% REAL TIME.AFTER ALL WAS A GREAT DEAL AND IT WORKS GREAT

Reviews.Title: Not a trustworthy Company
Reviews.Author: B. Offor
Reviews.Content: The company advertized a $30 rebate for each unit sold. I bought 4 and the company refused to honor the rebate for no reason. All requirements were met. When I spoke with the customer rep Gol, she said they were sorry that it is one rebate per family. It was not what they advertized. However, they sent 4 cards out to me and claimed the household was rejected because rebates were already processed for the address. False advertizing.The camera is for day light use only, period. The resolution is very poor if you want to view the image on a full screen. The frames are very slow that from onr frame to the other takes very long. It is a cheap camera and that is the only good thing about it. However, it is a waist of money. I will not buy from this company anymore, not even for other products from them. Before delving into buying this product, company with other models.If you know IP networking very well, it should be a synch to setup and it only works on windows. I suspect that the better reviews this camera get is from the company, they login to boost the review.

Reviews.Title: Know What I'm Doing - Camera Didnt Work
Reviews.Author: M. McNeil
Reviews.Content: I'm a reasonably experienced person when it comes to setting up network items - with several other IP cameras, network servers, etc. - and this one didn't work.I tried it with both their 'wizard' and manually setting up the camera - both failed.  The camera lost all IP and other settings each time it rebooted, making it essentially useless on a network.  And their tech support didn't supply any helpful info, either.The camera is on its way back to Amazon (which, by the way, was efficient in managing the return).

Reviews.Title: Needs EXPERT networking knowledge to get this this running
Reviews.Author: Sri P. Rangarajan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a security measure to monitor my home when I was away. Could not set up the camera remotely. It works fine when on home network. Numerous call and after spending over 4 hours with tech support, still was unable to resolve the issue.The tech support keeps saying open the port on your router and even after it is opened, it still is not viewable from a remote location. The manual is HOPELESS, does not talk anything about configuring from a remote location, setup of a static IP address, opening ports on the router nothing. Ultimately, tech support falls back on their excuse of "we cannot help with other routers". Isn't the camera supposed to work with any router and not just a Trendnet router? I will be happy if they stop playing this chicken and egg game and produce an IP camera that is easy to operate remotely without someone having any EXPERT networking knowledge. They advertise it as a networking camera, but nothing more than a nanny cam that can only be viewed on the home network.

Reviews.Title: cannot configure
Reviews.Author: bern777 "bernie1@mediaone.net"
Reviews.Content: The software is bad and support is awful. After wirking on this for over a month I gave up.... Cannot view over internet. Support gives brief answers that are usually irevelent......................

Reviews.Title: I am not a router expert...
Reviews.Author: psquare
Reviews.Content: ...but I guess neither are their customer support "experts."  To make a long story short, after finally getting a hold of someone that spoke english, I was told to call ATT and then call them back. After calling back with ATT's instructions and still not getting any results, I was finally told by these "extremely helpful" individuals that "oh yeah" if you have an ATT (2wire) modem and you cannot get a static IP address from them then you are basically out of luck. I would have to purchase a static IP address from ATT if they would sell me one (which he doubted they would). Considering that not many people have ATT DSL lines (yes, I am being sarcastic) that should not be a problem and they obviously don't see a need to warn consumers. If you want to lose your shipping charges and waste three hours of your life go for it and buy the camera. P.S. If you have a case number assigned, such as when you call back a second time, be prepared to wait much longer for assistance.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and work great...
Reviews.Author: S. Charney "Scott"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these recently.  I was a little skeptical, but after reading all the reviews, couldn't pass up on the price.  We've been wanted to setup a wireless security system for some time, so finally broke down and purchased these.  The setup via the installation CD makes getting them on your home wireless network a breeze.  The setup for remote viewing was a little more complex, but once I found a TRENDnet DIY setup on YouTube, life was a breeze.  They went step by step on how to setup the remote viewing.From start to finish, all setup and running in about two hours.  That included the time looking online for how to do the remote viewing.  The SecurView software is great, as you can watch up to 16 cameras live.  Works great with two cameras.  Does bog down my PC a bit if I want to multi-task, but if all I'm watching is the cameras, it works great.Great product, plan to buy more TrendNet Cameras to complete the system.
